law_text: No person shall drive a vehicle upon a highway at a speed greater than is reasonable or prudent having due regard for weather, visibility, traffic, and surface conditions.
preventive_tip: Adjust speed for weather, traffic, and road conditions.
rule_summary: Drivers must travel at a reasonable and prudent speed based on real-time conditions such as weather, visibility, traffic, and road surface.

penalty_structure.fine_note: May increase based on circumstances and local assessments

law_text: A person shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway unless that person and all passengers 16 years of age or over are properly restrained by a safety belt.
preventive_tip: Buckle up before you start driving.
rule_summary: Drivers must ensure they and passengers aged 16+ are properly restrained by a safety belt while operating a vehicle on a highway.

law_text: Drivers may not hold and operate a handheld wireless telephone or electronic communications device while driving.
penalty: Base fine varies; increased penalties for repeat offenses
preventive_tip: Use hands-free and set navigation before moving.
rule_summary: Drivers are prohibited from holding and operating handheld phones or electronic communication devices while driving.

penalty_structure.fine_note: Base fine varies; higher penalties for repeat offenses
